intro: Arrabidaea guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. It has a woody stem and produces pods that contain seeds covered in a hairy coating. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely used for commercial purposes.
